name: v2.4.4
body:
## 2.4.4

- [CHANGED] pusher.pro narrower proguard rules.

name: v2.4.3
body:
## 2.4.3

- [FIXED] Fix issue with json serialization when using proguard

name: v2.4.2
body:
* Fixes a crash when an event comes in without and escaped data json member.
* update to com.google.code.gson:gson:2.9.1
* update to org.java-websocket:Java-WebSocket:1.5.3

name: v2.4.1
body:
* Refactoring and code cleanup of event handling in the SDK
* Fixes subscription_count events

name: Subscription Count
body:
### Version 2.4.0 - 15th July 2022
* Add support for Subscription count events

name: v2.3.0-beta
body:
- Added support for user sign in and server to user messages
- Fixed issue with calling disconnect while the client is attempting reconnection
- Fixed issue with calling connect while the client is disconnecting

name: v2.2.8
body: Add global [event listner](https://github.com/pusher/pusher-websocket-java/issues/305)

name: v2.2.7
body: Fixed an [issue Vulnerability with legacy Gson dependency](https://github.com/pusher/pusher-websocket-java/issues/305)
Fixed an [issue causing a NullPointerException if event data on a Presence channel was malformed or missing](https://github.com/pusher/pusher-websocket-java/pull/290)

name: v2.2.5
body: Fixed an [issue with the Java-WebSocket library with android pre-sdk24 devices causing a NoSuchMethod exception](https://github.com/pusher/pusher-websocket-java/pull/284)

name: v.2.2.4
body:
* Removed unnecessary code in the TweetNaClFast implementation
* Updated the Java-WebSocket library to 1.5.1 as the [current version 1.4.0 has a known critical vulnerablity.](https://github.com/pusher/pusher-websocket-java/issues/279)

name: v2.2.3
body: Fixed LazySodium causing a crash on Android devices by swapping it out for [TweetNaCl](https://github.com/InstantWebP2P/tweetnacl-java)

name: v2.2.2
body: Fixed an issue where some private encrypted messages were not decrypted accurately by swapping our implementation of SecretBoxOpener for one provided by [Lazy Sodium](https://github.com/terl/lazysodium-java)

name: v2.2.1
body: Changed PusherOptions `setForceTLS` and `isForceTLS` to `setUseTLS` and `isUseTLS` to align with the other client SDKs.

name: v.2.2.0
body: Changed PusherOptions `setEncrypted` and `isEncrypted` to `setForceTLS` and `isForceTLS` to reduce confusion between this option and private encrypted channels.

name: v2.1.1
body: * Fix a case where multiple websocket connections could be opened at once if reconnection was triggered by an activity timeout.

name: v2.1.0
body: Add private encrypted channels.

name: v2.0.2
body: * Make a no-op state change non-fatal, allowing transitions to/from the same state

name: v2.0.1
body: * Forward `channel_data` returned by the auth endpoint when subscribing to private channels

name: v2.0.0
body:
* The onEvent handler now gets called with one parameter, called the PusherEvent. This PusherEvent has all the same information available as was available before with the 3 parameters, but now is accessible by calling getChannelName(), getData() or getEventName() on the PusherEvent object you receive. In addition, for presence channel client events, you can now retrieve an authenticated User ID by calling getUserId() on the PusherEvent object. To read more on Authenticated users, see the README or our docs [here](https://pusher.com/docs/channels/using_channels/events#user-id-in-client-events).
* Update Java sourceCompatibility and targetCompatibility to 1.8.
* Fix an issue where the reconnect logic would not be reset after connect() is called again.
* Depend on `org.java-websocket:Java-WebSocket:1.4.0` instead of `com.pusher:java-websocket:1.4.1`.

name: v1.8.2
body: This release improves compliance with Pusher Protocol.

name: Version 1.8.1
body: Bug fix: NPE fix when iterating through ids in the SubscriptionSuccessfulMessage: https://github.com/pusher/pusher-websocket-java/pull/184

name: Version 1.8.0
body: Added the option to configure maximum number of reconnection attempts

name: Version 1.7.0
body: Allow additional body types for POST authorization

name: Version 1.6.1
body: Fix linking of JavaDoc and Sources

name: Version 1.6.0
body: - Remove dependency on SLF4J in favour of Java logging

name: Version 1.5.0
body:
- Allow submitting any valid JSON as data when triggering private events
- Bug fixes and error handling

name: Version 1.4.0
body: The dependency on Clojars repository is gone! This version uses the `com.pusher.java_websocket` instead of the `org.java_websocket` library.

name: Release 1.3.0
body:
- Add retry logic when the connection is lost
- Accept 201 status code from auth endpoints

name: v1.2.0
body: Expose `Client` interface for use in pusher/pusher-websocket-android

name: v1.1.3
body:
- Fix Rejected Execution Exception on SingleThreadedExecutor
- Reduce construction of GSON objects.

name: v1.1.2
v1.1.1
body: Removes the dependency on log4j, as this was causing warnings and in some cases build errors.

name: Add setProxy to PusherOptions
body: - This release allows you to specify a proxy via which to connect to Pusher

name: pusher-java-client-1.0.1
body: - Resolves issues where Gson would cast numeric user ids as doubles before converting them to a string, leading to inconsistencies.
